question: Which of the following R data structures are homogeneous:

answers.feedback: Incorrect.  A list can contain any type of data.
Incorrect.  A column of a data frame can be of any data type, but the data within a given column must be of the same type.
Incorrect.  A tibble is a modified data frame.

question: Which if the following is true of a matrix?

answers.feedback: Incorrect.  The matrix can have unequal dimensions.
Correct.  A matrix is a special type of array.

question: When working with data frames, you must be cautious because:

answers.answer: If different data types exist in the data frame, all data will be coerced to a single type.
answers.feedback: Incorrect.  A data frame is a heterogeneous data structure.

answers.answer: If a given column contains different data types, all data within that column will be coerced to a single data type.
Missing data will be thrown out.
answers.feedback: Incorrect.  R can account for missing data.

answers.answer: R may become confused if your imported input files are not well-formatted.
